Chinese Traditional (CHT): 朱志香悲傷的聲音，回蕩於玫瑰庭園之中…。

Steam (ST): Perhaps it was the intuition of a person who lived on this island.

Umineko Project (UP): ...After Jessica had looked in the rose garden where Auntie Rosa and Maria had fallen and seen nothing, she had gone to look in the arbor next.

PC Japanese (JP): …朱志香は薔薇庭園の、楼座叔母さんたちが倒れていた場所を見て、何もないことを確かめると、次に東屋を見に行った。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …朱志香は薔薇庭園の、楼座叔母さんたちが倒れていた場所を見て、何もないことを確かめると、次に東屋を見に行った。
Russian (RU): ...Когда Джессика заглянула в то место в розарии, где пали тётя Роза и Мария, и ничего не обнаружила, она прошла ещё дальше до самой беседки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Depois que Jessica olhou no jardim de rosas onde a tia Rosa e a Maria haviam caído e não viu nada, ela foi olhar próximo ao gazebo.

Chinese Simplified (CN): …朱志香在玫瑰庭园确认了之前楼座姑母母女倒着的场所，发现什么都没有后，就直接跑去确认亭子。

Umineko Project (UP): Normally, the arbor was probably a wonderful location to enjoy tea peacefully while appreciating the roses on a good sunny day.
Steam (ST): Normally, the arbor was probably a wonderful location to enjoy tea peacefully while appreciating the roses on a good sunny day.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Normally, the arbor was probably a wonderful location to enjoy tea peacefully while appreciating the roses on a good sunny day.
PC Japanese (JP): 東屋は、本来なら天気の良い日に薔薇を愛でながらお茶をするのに最高のロケーションだろう。
Russian (RU): Обычно беседка была наиболее подходящим местом, чтобы мирно насладиться чаем и полюбоваться розами в хороший солнечный день.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Normalmente, o gazebo é um local maravilhoso para se aproveitar um chá pacificamente enquanto aprecia o jardim de rosas em um belo dia de sol.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……搞不好，藏臼伯父和夏妃伯母，也曾兩人一起，於此愜意地喝過茶也說不定。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……搞不好，藏臼伯父和夏妃伯母，也曾两人一起，于此惬意地喝过茶也说不定。

Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......In that arbor lay the corpses of Krauss oji-san and Natsuhi oba-san.
PC Japanese (JP): ……その東屋に、蔵臼伯父さんと夏妃伯母さんの遺体が横たわっていた。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Naquele gazebo estavam caídos os corpos do tio Krauss e da Natsuhi.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): At least they aren't drenched in the rain like Rosa oba-san and Maria had been, but there was no way I could say that out loud to Jessica at the moment...
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座叔母さんたちの時と違い、せめて雨曝しになっていないのだけが幸いだろうが、そんなこと、今の朱志香に口にできるわけもない…。

Speaker: Nanjo Terumasa
Umineko Project (UP): "Str‐...strangulation, I believe. ...Take a look at this. On their necks, there are distinct markings that something thin was used to strangle them."

Umineko Project (UP): When we had found these sticking out of my parents' forehead and chest, we had decided to leave them exactly as they were for the police and to preserve the crime scene, ......but Jessica no longer cared about such matters, and immediately pulled the stakes out of her parents' forsaken bodies.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「什么无人生还啊…。……我要杀了她…！绝对要用这双手，杀死杀害爸爸妈妈的犯人…！！」

Umineko Project (UP): Jessica howled furiously, her emotions laid bare. ......To avoid being crushed by her grief, she could do nothing but resist it with anger.
Steam (ST): Jessica let her emotions flow out as she howled furiously. ...To avoid being crushed by grief, she could do nothing but resist it with anger.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Jessica let her emotions flow out as she howled furiously.......To avoid being crushed by her grief, she could do nothing but resist it with anger.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香は感情をむき出しにして吼え猛る。……悲しみに押し潰されないためには、怒りでそれに抗う他がないのだ。
Russian (RU): Джессика, воя от горького гнева, позволила всем своим эмоциям выйти наружу. ......Чтобы не оказаться раздавленной горем, ей ничего не оставалось, кроме как противопоставить этому свой гнев.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Jessica rugiu em fúria, com suas emoções à flor da pele. ......Para evitar ser esmagada por sua tristeza, ela não podia fazer nada além de resistir com sua fúria.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 朱志香顯露出亢奮的感情，激動地吼叫著。……要想不被悲傷壓垮，除了以憤怒對抗外，別無他法。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 朱志香显露出亢奋的感情，激动地吼叫着。……要想不被悲伤压垮，除了以愤怒对抗外，别无他法。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Umineko Project (UP): ".........We still...haven't found George. ...Jessica‐chan, and the rest of you, you can stay here if you want. I'll go to the mansion."
Steam (ST): "...We still...haven't found George. ...Jessica, you children had better stay here. I'll go into the mansion."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......We still, ...haven't found George. ...Jessica, you children better stay here. I'll go in the mansion."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………まだ、…譲治が見つかってないわ。…朱志香ちゃんたちは、ここにいたければいるといい。私は屋敷へ行くわ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………まだ、…譲治が見つかってないわ。…朱志香ちゃんたちは、ここにいたければいるといい。私は屋敷へ行くわ」
Russian (RU): "......Мы всё ещё... не нашли Джорджа. ...Джессика, вам, детям, лучше оставаться здесь. Я иду в особняк."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Nós ainda...não encontramos o George. ...Jessica‐chan, e o resto de vocês, podem ficar aqui se quiserem. Eu vou voltar para a mansão."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………還沒，…找到讓治哦。…朱志香你們想待在這的話，就待這好了。我去大屋。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………还没，…找到让治哦。…朱志香你们想待在这的话，就待这好了。我去大屋。」

Speaker: Nanjo Terumasa
Umineko Project (UP): "E‐Eva‐san, we mustn't split up...!! It is dangerous if we do not all stick together...!"
Steam (ST): "E-Eva-san, we mustn't split up...!! It's dangerous if we do not all stick together...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "E, Eva-san, we mustn't split up...!! It is dangerous if we do not all stick together...!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「え、絵羽さん、バラバラに行動してはいけない…！！　みんなで一緒に行動しなくては危険です…！」
Russian (RU): "Е... Ева‐сан, нам не следует разделяться! Это опасно, если мы не будем держаться вместе!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "E‐Eva‐san, nós não devíamos nos separar...!! Vai ser mais perigoso se não ficarmos todos juntos...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「繪、繪羽，不可以分散行動…！！不大家一起行動的話，是很危險的…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「绘、绘羽，不可以分散行动…！！不大家一起行动的话，是很危险的…！」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Umineko Project (UP): "There's nothing we can do for Nii‐san or his wife. But George may be still alive somewhere...! I have no time to waste here...!!"
Steam (ST): "There's nothing we can do for Nii-san or his wife. But George may be still alive somewhere...! I have no time to waste here...!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "There's nothing we can do for Nii-san or his wife. But George may be still alive somewhere...! I have no time to waste here...!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「兄さんたちはもうどうしようもないわ。でも譲治はまだどこかで生きてるかも知れない…！　ここで時間を潰してる暇はないのよ…！！」
Russian (RU): "Мы уже ничего не сможем сделать для нии‐сана и его жены. Но Джордж всё ещё может где‐то находиться живым!.. Я не могу попусту тратить здесь время!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não há nada que possamos fazer pelo nii‐san ou sua esposa. Mas o George ainda pode estar vivo em algum lugar...! Eu não posso perder tempo aqui...!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哥他們已經沒救了。但是，讓治說不定在哪還活著…！沒工夫在這浪費時間喲…！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哥他们已经没救了。但是，让治说不定在哪还活着…！没工夫在这浪费时间哟…！！」

Umineko Project (UP): As Auntie Eva screamed this, Jessica glared at her.
Steam (ST): As Aunt Eva screamed this, Jessica glared at her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As Eva oba-san screamed this, Jessica glared at her.
PC Japanese (JP): 絵羽伯母さんがそう叫ぶと、朱志香はぎょろりと睨みつける。
Russian (RU): Когда тётя Ева прокричала это, Джессика зло посмотрела на неё.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando a tia Eva gritou isso, a Jessica olhou para ela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 聽繪羽姑母這麼一喊，朱志香便狠狠地瞪向了她。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 听绘羽姑母这么一喊，朱志香便狠狠地瞪向了她。

Umineko Project (UP): ...Auntie Eva had no more time to bother about the dead.{n}She was more concerned for the safety of her only son, who was yet to be seen.
Steam (ST): ...Eva had no more time to bother about the dead. She was more concerned for the safety of her only son, who had yet to be seen.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Eva had no more time to bother about the dead. She was more concerned for the safety of her only son, who had yet to be seen.
PC Japanese (JP): …彼女にはもはや、死者にこれ以上構う暇はないのだ。まだ姿の見えない一人息子の安否の方が気がかりなのだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …彼女にはもはや、死者にこれ以上構う暇はないのだ。{n}まだ姿の見えない一人息子の安否の方が気がかりなのだ。
Russian (RU): ...У Евы больше не оставалось времени, чтобы переживать за мёртвых.{n}Её гораздо больше беспокоила безопасность её единственного сына, которого она до сих пор не увидела.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...A tia Eva não tem mais tempo para se preocupar com os mortos.{n}Ela está mais preocupada com a segurança do seu único filho, que ainda não havia sido encontrado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …她已完全不想再在死者身上花一點點時間了。{n}讓她更為擔心的是，那還不見踪影的獨子的安危。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …她已完全不想再在死者身上花一点点时间了。{n}让她更为担心的是，那还不见踪影的独子的安危。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Umineko Project (UP): "Jessica‐chan, you should stay by your father and mother's side. I'll make a short trip to the mansion. Battler‐kun and Doctor Nanjo, you two can stay here with her as well."
Steam (ST): "Jessica-chan, you should stay by your father and mother's side. I'll make a short trip to the mansion. Battler-kun and Doctor Nanjo, you two can stay here as well."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Jessica-chan, you should stay by your father and mother's side. I'll make a short trip to the mansion. Battler-kun and Doctor Nanjo, you two can stay here as well."
PC Japanese (JP): 「朱志香ちゃんはここでお父さんとお母さんの傍にいるといい。私はちょっと屋敷に行ってくるわ。戦人くんも南條先生もここにいてくれていい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「朱志香ちゃんはここでお父さんとお母さんの傍にいるといい。私はちょっと屋敷に行ってくるわ。戦人くんも南條先生もここにいてくれていい」
Russian (RU): "Джессика‐чан, ты можешь оставаться со своими отцом и матерью. Я быстро сбегаю в особняк. Баттлер‐кун и доктор Нанджо, вы оба можете оставаться здесь."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Jessica‐chan, você deve ficar ao lado do seu pai e da sua mãe. Eu vou fazer uma rápida visita à mansão. Battler‐kun, Doutor Nanjo, vocês dois podem ficar aqui com ela."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「朱志香就這麼留在父母身邊好了。我稍微去下大屋。戰人君與南條大夫也留這好了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「朱志香就这么留在父母身边好了。我稍微去下大屋。战人君与南条大夫也留这好了。」

Umineko Project (UP): After saying this and leaving no time for debate, Auntie Eva rushed out of the arbor.
Steam (ST): After arbitrarily saying this, Aunt Eva rushed out of the arbor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After arbitrarily saying this, Eva oba-san rushed out of the arbor.
PC Japanese (JP): 絵羽伯母さんは、それだけを一方的に言うと、東屋を飛び出していく。
Russian (RU): После этих торопливо сказанных слов, тётя Ева выбежала из беседки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Após dizer isso e partir sem tempo para discutir, a tia Eva saiu apressada do gazebo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪羽姑母單方面地說完這段話後，便跑出了亭子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘羽姑母单方面地说完这段话后，便跑出了亭子。

Umineko Project (UP): I called out for her to stop, but there was no way she would listen.
Steam (ST): I called out to stop her, but there was no way she would listen.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I called out to stop her, but there was no way she would listen.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺が、待てよと声を掛けるが、足を止めるわけもなかった。
Russian (RU): Я крикнул, чтобы она остановилась, но вряд ли она меня услышала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu a chamei dizendo para parar, mas até parece que ela iria me ouvir.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然我叫她等等，但她根本不可能停下腳步。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然我叫她等等，但她根本不可能停下脚步。

Umineko Project (UP): ...However, by now, being alone in this situation meant nothing short of death.
Steam (ST): ...However, being alone in this situation meant nothing short of death.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...However, being alone in this situation meant nothing short of death.
PC Japanese (JP): …しかし、この状況下でひとり孤立することは、今や死を意味する。
Russian (RU): ...Однако оставаться в одиночестве в подобной ситуации означало лишь верную смерть.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Porém, nesse momento, ficar sozinho em uma situação como essa significa nada menos que a morte.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …不過，在現在這個狀況下，孤立就意味著死。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …不过，在现在这个状况下，孤立就意味着死。

Umineko Project (UP): If we silently watched her leave, it would be the same as letting her die.{n}As long as Auntie Eva was unwilling to stop, we would have no choice but to follow her.
Steam (ST): If we silently watched her leave, it would be the same as letting her die. Since Aunt Eva was unwilling to stop, we had no choice but to follow her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If we silently watched her leave, it would be the same as letting her die. Since Eva oba-san was unwilling to stop, we had no choice but to follow her.
PC Japanese (JP): 黙って行かせれば、それは見殺しを意味するのだ。絵羽伯母さんが足を止めない以上、俺たちは彼女を追うしかない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 黙って行かせれば、それは見殺しを意味するのだ。{n}絵羽伯母さんが足を止めない以上、俺たちは彼女を追うしかない。
Russian (RU): Если мы молча позволим ей уйти, то практически обречём её на смерть.{n}Поскольку тётя Ева отказывалась остановиться, у нас не было другого выбора, кроме как следовать за ней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se ficarmos em silêncio vendo ela se distanciar, seria o mesmo que a deixar morrer. Como a tia Eva estava decidida a não parar, não tivemos outra escolha a não ser segui‐la.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 一聲不吭地讓她去，意味著見死不救。{n}既然繪羽姑母不肯停步，那就只好由我們去追她了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 一声不吭地让她去，意味着见死不救。{n}既然绘羽姑母不肯停步，那就只好由我们去追她了。

Umineko Project (UP): ......And, while it may be cruel to say so, Uncle Krauss and Aunt Natsuhi were already dead, so there was nothing more we could do for them...
Steam (ST): ...And, while it may be cruel to say so, Uncle Krauss and Aunt Natsuhi were already dead, so there was nothing more we could do for them...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......And, while it may be cruel to say so, Krauss oji-san and Natsuhi oba-san were already dead, so there was nothing more we could do for them...
PC Japanese (JP): ……それに、残酷ではあるが、蔵臼伯父さんたちはすでに死んでいて、これ以上できることは何もない…。
Russian (RU): ......И пусть даже жестоко так говорить, но дядя Краусс и тётя Нацухи были уже мертвы, поэтому для них мы ничего сделать больше не могли...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......E, ao mesmo tempo que pode ser cruel dizer isso, o tio Krauss e a tia Natsuhi já estão mortos, então não há mais nada que possamos fazer por eles...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……而且，雖說很是殘酷，但藏臼伯父他們已經死了，再待著也無事可做…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……而且，虽说很是残酷，但藏臼伯父他们已经死了，再待着也无事可做…。

Umineko Project (UP): In the end, we had no choice but to console Jessica and head for the mansion together.
Steam (ST): In the end, we had no choice but to console Jessica and head for the mansion together.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the end, we had no choice but to console Jessica and head for the mansion together.
PC Japanese (JP): 結局、俺たちは、朱志香を慰めて、全員で屋敷に行く他なかった。
Russian (RU): В итоге, у нас не было другого выбора, кроме как, утешая Джессику, вместе последовать в особняк.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No fim, não tivemos escolha além de consolar a Jessica e irmos juntos para a mansão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 結果，我們只好決定，在安慰了朱志香後，全員一起去大屋。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 结果，我们只好决定，在安慰了朱志香后，全员一起去大屋。

Umineko Project (UP): ...Fortunately, Jessica stood up.
Steam (ST): ...Fortunately, Jessica stood up.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …幸い、朱志香は立ち上がってくれた。
Russian (RU): ...К счастью, Джессика сама поднялась.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Felizmente, a Jessica se levantou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …幸好，朱志香也振作了起來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …幸好，朱志香也振作了起来。

Umineko Project (UP): Perhaps she had been able to draw a line under her grief for the moment. ......But, what had surfaced in its place was an expression like a demon.
Steam (ST): Perhaps she had been able to break free from her grief. ...But...what had surfaced in its place was an expression like a demon's.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Perhaps she had been able to break free from her grief.......But, what had surfaced in its place was an expression like a demon.
PC Japanese (JP): 悲しみに一区切りがついたのだろう。……しかし、代わりに浮かべている形相はまるで鬼のそれだ。
Russian (RU): Возможно, ей удалось подавить своё горе. ......Но выражение, возникшее на её лице, больше походило на демоническое.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Talvez ela tenha sido capaz de traçar uma linha sobre sua tristeza, mesmo que momentaneamente. ......Mas a expressão que estava em sua superfície era como a de um demônio.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 是悲傷告一段落了吧。……不過，取代此而浮現的神情猶如惡鬼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 是悲伤告一段落了吧。……不过，取代此而浮现的神情犹如恶鬼。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "...I'll murder 'em with my own hands, ......I'll avenge my parents, just you wait......... ......Let's go, Battler. If we find whoever did this, don't get in my way. I'm definitely gonna kill them...!!"
Steam (ST): "...I'll kill that person with my own hands, ...I'll definitely avenge them...... ...Let's go, Battler. If we find the culprit, don't get in my way. I'm definitely gonna kill them...!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...I'll kill that person with my hands, ......I'll make sure I avenge them...............Let's go, Battler. If we find the culprit, don't get in my way. I'm definitely going to kill them...!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「…私がこの手でぶっ殺して、……必ず仇を取ってやる………。……行こうぜ、戦人。犯人を見つけたら邪魔をするなよ。私が絶対に殺す…！！」
Russian (RU): "...Я убью этого человека собственными руками... ......Я непременно отомщу за них... ......Идём, Баттлер. Если мы найдём виновника, не становитесь на моём пути. Я однозначно поубиваю их!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Eu vou matá‐lo com as minhas próprias mãos, ......eu vou vingar meus pais, pode esperar......... ......Vamos, Battler. Se encontrarmos quem fez isso, não fique no meu caminho. Eu definitivamente vou matá‐lo...!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…我要親手殺了她，……一定要報仇雪恨………。……走嘞，戰人。要是找到犯人了，可別來礙事。我絕對要殺了她…！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…我要亲手杀了她，……一定要报仇雪恨………。……走嘞，战人。要是找到犯人了，可别来碍事。我绝对要杀了她…！！」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): ".........I also have my parents to avenge. Sorry, but this is first come, first served."
Steam (ST): "......I've got my own parents to avenge. Sorry, but this is first come, first serve."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........I also have my parents to avenge. Sorry, but this is first come, first serve."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………俺も親父たちの仇があるんだ。悪ぃが早い者勝ちだぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………俺も親父たちの仇があるんだ。悪ぃが早い者勝ちだぜ」
Russian (RU): ".........У меня тоже остались неотомщённые родители. Извини, кто первый — тот и начнёт."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Eu também tenho que vingar meus pais. Desculpa, mas vai ser de quem pegar primeiro."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………我也有老爸他們那筆仇要算。不好意思，誰快算誰的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………我也有老爸他们那笔仇要算。不好意思，谁快算谁的。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "...Yeah, ...that's right... ......Let's make mincemeat of that bastard!"
Steam (ST): "...Yeah, ...that's right... ...Let's kill them!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...Yeah, ...that's right.........Let's kill them!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「…あぁ、…そうだな…。……ぶっ殺してやろうぜッ！」
Russian (RU): "...Да... это верно... ......Убьём гадов!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Sim, ...isso mesmo... ......Vamos acabar com esse desgraçado!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…是啊，…說的也是…。……去殺了她！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…是啊，…说的也是…。……去杀了她！」

Umineko Project (UP): At my words, Jessica finally seemed to feel like someone had sympathized with her emotions.
Steam (ST): At my words, Jessica finally seemed to feel like we sympathized with her emotions.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At my words, Jessica finally seemed to feel like we sympathized with her emotions.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺の言葉に、ようやく朱志香は自らの気持ちを共感してもらえたことを感じたのだろう。
Russian (RU): После моих слов Джессика, похоже, наконец почувствовала, что её эмоции тоже нашли поддержку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com minhas palavras, a Jessica finalmente pareceu ter simpatizado novamente com suas emoções.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 或許是我的話語總算令朱志香感到自身的心情獲得了共鳴吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 或许是我的话语总算令朱志香感到自身的心情获得了共鸣吧。

Umineko Project (UP): She still had that dark expression, but I felt Jessica regaining some of her sanity.
Steam (ST): She still had that dark expression, but I felt that Jessica had regained some of her sanity.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She still had that dark expression, but I felt that Jessica had regained some of her sanity.
PC Japanese (JP): 物騒な表情ではあるが、少しだけ朱志香が正気に戻るのを感じた。
Russian (RU): Она всё ещё была накручена, но я чувствовал, что Джессика стала хотя бы немного вменяемой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela ainda estava com uma expressão sombria, mas sinto que ela havia recuperado um pouco da sua sanidade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 儘管還是凶相畢露，但我感覺朱志香稍許取回了些理智。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 尽管还是凶相毕露，但我感觉朱志香稍许取回了些理智。

Umineko Project (UP): We took off.{n}Chasing after Auntie Eva.
Steam (ST): We took off. Chasing after Aunt Eva.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We took off. Chasing after Eva oba-san.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺たちは駆け出す。絵羽伯母さんの後を追う。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 俺たちは駆け出す。{n}絵羽伯母さんの後を追う。
Russian (RU): Мы побежали.{n}Погнались за тётей Евой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nós estamos indo.{n}Indo atrás da tia Eva.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我們跑了出去。{n}追在繪羽姑母的後面。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我们跑了出去。{n}追在绘羽姑母的后面。

Umineko Project (UP): Through the rose garden, up the stone steps, running at full speed towards the mansion......whose large, intimidating shadow flashed in the lightning.
Steam (ST): Through the rose garden, up the stone steps, running at full speed towards the mansion, ...whose large, intimidating shadow flashed in the lightning.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Through the rose garden, up the stone steps, running at full speed towards the mansion......whose large, intimidating shadow flashed in the lightning.
PC Japanese (JP): 薔薇庭園を駆け抜け、石段を駆け上がり、……稲光にその大きな黒い影で威圧するような、屋敷をまっしぐらに目指す。
Russian (RU): Через розарий, вверх по каменным ступеням, мы во весь опор бежали в направлении особняка, огромная тень которого прорезалась во вспышках молний.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Através do jardim de rosas, subindo os degraus de pedra, correndo a toda velocidade em direção à mansão......cuja a imponente e intimidadora sombra reluziu com o relâmpago.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 飛奔過玫瑰庭園，跑上石階，……直奔那仿彿在以閃電照出的巨大黑影示以威懾的，大屋。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 飞奔过玫瑰庭园，跑上石阶，……直奔那仿佛在以闪电照出的巨大黑影示以威慑的，大屋。

Umineko Project (UP): ......With this, the epitaph murders had finished the eighth twilight.{n}And now, on the ninth twilight, the witch will revive.{n}...None shall be left alive.
Steam (ST): ...With this, the murders of the epitaph have reached the eighth twilight. And then, on the ninth twilight, the witch shall revive. ...None shall be left alive.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......With this, the murders of the epitaph have reached the eighth twilight. And then, at the ninth twilight, the witch will revive....None shall be left alive.
PC Japanese (JP): ……これで、碑文の殺人は第八の晩を終えた。そして続く第九の晩に、魔女は蘇る。…誰も生き残れはしない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……これで、碑文の殺人は第八の晩を終えた。{n}そして続く第九の晩に、魔女は蘇る。{n}…誰も生き残れはしない。
Russian (RU): ......Итак, убийства по эпитафии уже достигли восьмых сумерек.{n}А затем, к девятым сумеркам же возродится ведьма.{n}...И кто в живых остался — будет мёртв.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Com isso, os assassinatos do epitáfio chegaram ao fim no oitavo crepúsculo.{n}E agora, no nono crepúsculo, a bruxa deve reviver.{n}...E ninguém deve sobreviver.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……至此，碑文殺人已完成了第八晚。{n}然後，接下來是第九晚，魔女復甦。{n}…無人生還。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……至此，碑文杀人已完成了第八晚。{n}然后，接下来是第九晚，魔女复苏。{n}…无人生还。

Umineko Project (UP): I will most likely lose my life.
Steam (ST): I will most likely lose my life.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I will most likely lose my life.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺は命を、恐らく失うだろう。
Russian (RU): Я, скорее всего, лишусь жизни.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu provavelmente vou perder minha vida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我恐怕會喪命吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我恐怕会丧命吧。

Umineko Project (UP): ......But at the very least, I wanted to burn the truth into my eyes.{n}That was the only thing motivating me to move at that moment.
Steam (ST): ...But at the very least, I want to burn the truth into my eyes. That's the only thing motivating me to move right now.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......But at the very least, I want to burn the truth into my eyes. That is the only thing motivating me to move at the moment.
PC Japanese (JP): ……だがせめて、真相をこの目に焼き付けたい。それだけが、今の自分を動かす原動力だった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……だがせめて、真相をこの目に焼き付けたい。{n}それだけが、今の自分を動かす原動力だった。
Russian (RU): ......Но по крайней мере я хочу, чтобы правда отпечаталась в моих глазах.{n}Лишь это желание придавало мне сил двигаться в данный момент.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas, ao menos por um único instante, eu quero poder gravar a imagem da bruxa em meus olhos.{n}Essa era a única coisa que me motivava naquele momento.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……但是，我想至少將真相烙印在這雙眼睛之中。{n}這是此刻，驅使自己行動的，唯一的原動力。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……但是，我想至少将真相烙印在这双眼睛之中。{n}这是此刻，驱使自己行动的，唯一的原动力。

Umineko Project (UP): We were able to reunite with Auntie Eva, who was having trouble with the lock to the front door.
Steam (ST): We were able to meet up with Aunt Eva, who was having trouble with the lock to the front door.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We were able to reunite with Eva oba-san, who was having trouble with the lock to the front door.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺たちは、玄関で鍵開けに苦闘している絵羽伯母さんに何とか合流できた。
Russian (RU): Нам удалось воссоединиться с тётей Евой, которая никак не могла открыть замок на входной двери.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nós fomos capazes de nos juntarmos à tia Eva, que estava com dificuldades de abrir a porta da frente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我們總算是在大門前，與正與門鎖苦戰的繪羽姑母會合了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我们总算是在大门前，与正与门锁苦战的绘羽姑母会合了。

Umineko Project (UP): It seemed that all the blood had risen to Auntie Eva's head.{n}That was probably making her fingers clumsy.
Steam (ST): It seemed that all the blood had risen to Aunt Eva's head. That was probably making her fingers clumsy.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It seemed that all the blood had risen to Eva oba-san's head. That was probably making her fingers clumsy.
PC Japanese (JP): 絵羽伯母さんは相当頭に血が上っているようだ。それが指を不器用にさせてしまっているのだろう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 絵羽伯母さんは相当頭に血が上っているようだ。{n}それが指を不器用にさせてしまっているのだろう。
Russian (RU): Было видно, что в голову тёти Евы ударила кровь.{n}Похоже, из‐за этого ей никак не удавалось совладать со своими пальцами.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parece que todo o sangue havia subido para a cabeça dela.{n}Isso provavelmente a fez perder a coordenação motora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪羽姑母看起來大腦嚴重充血。{n}正因如此，所以手指不利索了吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘羽姑母看起来大脑严重充血。{n}正因如此，所以手指不利索了吧。

Umineko Project (UP): It seemed she couldn't even handle the simple task of inserting the key into the lock.
Steam (ST): It looked like she couldn't even handle the simple task of inserting the key into the lock.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It seemed she couldn't even handle the simple task of inserting the key into the lock.
PC Japanese (JP): ただ鍵穴に鍵を差し込むだけでも、うまく出来ないようだった。
Russian (RU): Казалось, ей было тяжело выполнить даже такую простую вещь, как вставить ключ в замок.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parece que ela não conseguia sequer executar a simples tarefa de inserir a chave na fechadura.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 僅僅是把鑰匙插進鑰匙孔，都顯得不甚順利。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 仅仅是把钥匙插进钥匙孔，都显得不甚顺利。

Umineko Project (UP): ...Then, there was a faint sound.
Steam (ST): ...Then, there was a faint sound.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …すると軽やかな音。
Russian (RU): ...Затем раздался негромкий звук.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Então, se ouviu um som enfraquecido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …接著，響起了輕輕一聲。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …接着，响起了轻轻一声。

Umineko Project (UP): The sound of the door unlocking. Just as though it had waited for all of the survivors to unite before opening.
Steam (ST): The sound of the door unlocking. Just as though it had waited for all the survivors to unite before opening.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The sound of the door unlocking. Just as though it had waited for all of the survivors to unite before opening.
PC Japanese (JP): 鍵の開く音がする。まるで、全ての生き残りが揃ったのを見計らって開いたかのよう。
Russian (RU): Звук открываемой ключом двери. Казалось, она словно ожидала, пока все выжившие соберутся перед ней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O som da porta sendo destrancada. Como se estivesse esperando que todos os sobreviventes estivessem reunidos antes de se abrir.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 是開鎖的聲音。簡直就像是看準了要在所有生存者都聚集在一起的那一刻打開一樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 是开锁的声音。简直就像是看准了要在所有生存者都聚集在一起的那一刻打开一样。

Umineko Project (UP): ......It seemed to me as though the malicious mansion...was trying to swallow all of the remaining humans at once...
Steam (ST): It felt to me as though the malicious mansion... was trying to swallow up all the remaining humans at once...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It seemed to me as though the malicious mansion, was trying to swallow all of the remaining humans at once...
PC Japanese (JP): ……悪意ある屋敷が、残った人間全てを一度に飲み込もうとしているかのように、俺には見えるのだった…。
Russian (RU): Мне почудилось, как будто зловещий особняк вознамерился разом проглотить всех оставшихся в живых людей...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Passou a impressão de que a mansão mal‐intencionada...estava tentando engolir todos os humanos remanescentes de uma só vez...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……在我看來，這就像是帶有惡意的大屋，想要一次性吞下剩下的所有人類…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……在我看来，这就像是带有恶意的大屋，想要一次性吞下剩下的所有人类…。

Umineko Project (UP): The stench that erupted outwards at the instant the door opened, ...could it really be explained as just a smell?
Steam (ST): Perhaps the stench that erupted outwards the instant the door opened... couldn't be described as just a smell.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Perhaps the stench that erupted outwards the instant the door opened, ...couldn't be described as just a smell.
PC Japanese (JP): 扉を開けた途端に中より噴出した異臭は、…果たして臭いだけで説明できるものだったのだろうか。
Russian (RU): Наверное, вонь, вырвавшуюся наружу, стоило только распахнуть дверь, довольно затруднительно было описать всего лишь как запах.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O fedor que entrou em erupção em nossa direção quando a porta se abriu, ...podia realmente ser descrito apenas como um odor?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那隨著開門，而從裡面噴涌而出的異臭，…究竟能不能僅僅將其解釋為臭味呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那随着开门，而从里面喷涌而出的异臭，…究竟能不能仅仅将其解释为臭味呢？

Umineko Project (UP): It wasn't just the charred smell from Grandfather.
Steam (ST): It wasn't just the charred smell from Grandfather.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It wasn't just the charred smell from Grandfather.
PC Japanese (JP): 祖父さまの焼け焦げた臭いだけじゃない。
Russian (RU): Это был не только запах обуглившегося тела дедушки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não era apenas o cheiro do corpo carbonizado do vovô.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我覺得，那不僅僅是爺爺屍體的焦臭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我觉得，那不仅仅是爷爷尸体的焦臭。

Umineko Project (UP): ......I think it may also have contained something like...regrets, held by so many dead, including our parents, and all of the servants.
Steam (ST): ...I think it also may have contained the regrets of the servants and Dad's group, ...all of the dead.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......I think it also may have contained the regrets of the servants and Dad's group, ...all of the dead.
PC Japanese (JP): ……多分、使用人の人たちや親父たちなどの、何人もの死者たちの無念のようなものも含まれていたのではないかと思う。
Russian (RU): ......Мне кажется, их дополнили запахи... сожалений всех мёртвых: наших родителей, прислуги.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Acho que continha ainda mais alguma coisa como...arrependimentos, mantido por tantas mortes, incluindo de nossos pais, e de todos os serviçais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……多半還混雜著，像是傭人們與老爸他們等，好幾位死者的冤魂之類的東西。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……多半还混杂着，像是佣人们与老爸他们等，好几位死者的冤魂之类的东西。

Umineko Project (UP): ...What did it mean as it billowed out, overwhelming us?
Steam (ST): ...What did it mean as it floated out, overwhelming us?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...What did it mean as it floated out, overwhelming us?
PC Japanese (JP): …それがぶわっと溢れ出し、俺たちを仰け反らせたのはどういう意味なのか。
Russian (RU): ...Что это амбре могло означать, вырвавшись наружу, подавляя нас?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Será que aquilo que estava emanando, na verdade, estava tentando nos empurrar para fora?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …那麼，它們一涌而出，將我們嚇得身子後仰，又意味著什麼呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): …那么，它们一涌而出，将我们吓得身子后仰，又意味着什么呢？

Umineko Project (UP): ......Was it the cry of the dead, telling us not to enter?
Steam (ST): ...Was it the cry of the dead, telling us not to enter?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Was it the cry of the dead, telling us not to enter?
PC Japanese (JP): ……入るな、という死者たちの叫びなのか。
Russian (RU): ......Был ли это крик мёртвых, говорящих нам не входить?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Era como o choro da morte, dizendo para que não entrássemos?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……是在告訴我們“別進來”的，死者們的呼喊嗎？
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……是在告诉我们“别进来”的，死者们的呼喊吗？

Umineko Project (UP): However, Auntie Eva didn't even flinch at something like that.
Steam (ST): However, Aunt Eva didn't even flinch at something like that.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, Eva oba-san didn't even flinch at something like that.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、絵羽伯母さんはそんなものには怯まない。
Russian (RU): Тем не менее, тётя Ева даже не дрогнула перед этим.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, a tia Eva sequer hesitou diante daquilo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，繪羽姑母並不會對此感到畏懼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，绘羽姑母并不会对此感到畏惧。

Umineko Project (UP): ......And we who had to chase after her...were forced to step into the mansion, despite receiving that message...
Steam (ST): ...And we who had to chase after her... were forced to step into the mansion, even after receiving that message...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......And we who had to chase after her, were forced to step into the mansion, even though we had received that message...
PC Japanese (JP): ……そして、彼女の背中を追わなければならない俺たちは、そのメッセージを受け取りつつも、屋敷に踏み入らねばならない…。
Russian (RU): ......И мы, которым пришлось следовать за ней, были вынуждены войти в особняк даже после того, как получили это предостережение...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......E nós que estávamos indo atrás dela...fomos forçados a entrar na mansão, apesar da mensagem que havia vindo até nós...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……而不得不跟著她的我們，儘管收到了這條訊息，還是別無選擇地踏入了大屋…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……而不得不跟着她的我们，尽管收到了这条讯息，还是别无选择地踏入了大屋…。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Umineko Project (UP): "George?! George!! If you can hear me, answer! Geoooooorge!!"
Steam (ST): "George?! George!! If you can hear me, answer! Geoooooorge!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「譲治？！　譲治！！　聞こえたら返事をしなさいッ！　譲治ぃいいぃ！！」
Russian (RU): "Джордж?! Джордж!!! Если ты меня слышишь, отзовись! Джо‐о‐о‐о‐о‐ордж!!!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "George?! George!! Se você consegue me ouvir, responda! Geoooooorge!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「讓治？！讓治！！聽到了，就回答一聲！讓治——！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「让治？！让治！！听到了，就回答一声！让治——！！」

Umineko Project (UP): Auntie Eva shouted at the top of her lungs.
Steam (ST): Aunt Eva shouted at the top of her lungs.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Eva oba-san shouted at the top of her lungs.
PC Japanese (JP): 絵羽伯母さんはあらん限りの声で叫ぶ。
Russian (RU): Тётя Ева кричала на пределе своих лёгких.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A tia Eva gritou usando de toda capacidade de seus pulmões.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪羽姑母盡其所能地大聲呼喊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘羽姑母尽其所能地大声呼喊。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Considering the situation, it's probably far too optimistic to imagine that he's alive.
Steam (ST): ...Considering the situation, it's probably far too optimistic to imagine that he's alive.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……状況を考えれば、生きていると考えるのは、あまりに楽観が過ぎるだろう。
Russian (RU): ......Учитывая ситуацию, возможно, было бы слишком оптимистично предполагать, что он всё ещё жив.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Considerando a situação, provavelmente é otimismo demais imaginar que ele está vivo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……考慮到實際情況，以為他還活著也未免過於樂觀了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……考虑到实际情况，以为他还活着也未免过于乐观了。

Umineko Project (UP): When we also started following Auntie Eva's example and calling George‐aniki's name in loud voices...
Steam (ST): When we started following Aunt Eva's example and calling out George's name in loud voices...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When we also started following Eva oba-san's example and calling George's name in loud voices...
PC Japanese (JP): 絵羽伯母さんに習って、俺たちも大声で譲治の兄貴の名を呼んだ時。
Russian (RU): Затем мы тоже последовали примеру тёти Евы и принялись громко звать имя Джорджа...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando começamos a seguir as ações da tia Eva e chamamos pelo nome do George‐aniki em voz alta...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在我們學著繪羽姑母的樣，大聲喊起讓治大哥的名字的時候，
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在我们学着绘羽姑母的样，大声喊起让治大哥的名字的时候，

Umineko Project (UP): ...Auntie Eva found something, and stopped walking.
Steam (ST): ...Aunt Eva spotted something...and stopped walking.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Eva oba-san found something, and stopped walking.
PC Japanese (JP): …絵羽伯母さんが何かを見つけ、足を止めた。
Russian (RU): ...Тётя Ева что‐то обнаружила и остановилась.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...a tia Eva encontrou algo, e parou de andar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …繪羽姑母發現了什麼，停住了腳步。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …绘羽姑母发现了什么，停住了脚步。

Umineko Project (UP): She was standing in front of the door to the parlor.
Steam (ST): She was standing in front of the door to the parlor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She was standing in front of the door to the parlor.
PC Japanese (JP): そこは客間の扉の前だった。
Russian (RU): Она стояла прямо перед дверью в гостиную.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela estava parada em frente à porta da sala de visitas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那是在客廳的門前。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那是在客厅的门前。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Umineko Project (UP): ".........What is this.........? D‐Doctor Nanjo, could you come here for a second......?"
Steam (ST): "......What is this......? D-Doctor Nanjo, could you come here for a second...?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........What is this.........? D, Doctor Nanjo, could you come here for a second......?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………これは………？な、南条先生、ちょっと来てもらえるかしら……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………これは………？　な、南條先生、ちょっと来てもらえるかしら……」
Russian (RU): ".........Что это?.. Д‐Доктор Нанджо, вы не могли бы подойти сюда на секунду?.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........O que é isso.........? D‐Doutor Nanjo, pode vir aqui um momento......?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………這是………？南、南條大夫，能不能過來一下……？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………这是………？南、南条大夫，能不能过来一下……？」

Speaker: Nanjo Terumasa
Umineko Project (UP): "Wh‐what is it......?"
Steam (ST): "Wh-What is it...?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Wh, what is it......?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「な、何事ですかな……。」
Russian (RU): "Чт‐что такое?.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O‐O que é isto......?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「什、什麼事吶……？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「什、什么事呐……？」

Umineko Project (UP): I had heard from the adults about the creepy magic circles that had been drawn on doors such as the one to the parlor.
Steam (ST): I'd heard about the eerie magic circles written on doors, like the one on the parlor, from the adults.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I had heard about the eerie magic circles written on doors such as the one to the parlor from the adults.
PC Japanese (JP): 大人たちから、客間の扉などに、不気味な魔法陣が書かれている、という話は聞いていた。

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ま、…魔{i:方}陣、というものかもしれませんな。……ある種の数字遊びに魔除けが宿るという考え方です。どの列を足しても同じ数字になる、みたいなものを、皆さんも見聞きしたことがおありでしょう…」

Tenho certeza que vocês todos já ouviram sobre aquilo que, onde somando todos os números de cada linha, leva sempre ao mesmo resultado..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「說、…說不定，是魔{i:方}陣吶。……那是一種，認為某類數字遊戲裡具有驅魔功效的見解。就是那種，無論哪一行、哪一列加起來，都等於相同數字的那種東西，諸位也都有所耳聞吧…？」

PC Japanese (JP): 「いや、…偶然だろうけどな。俺の誕生日、７月１５日なんだ。…０７１５が７月１５日を示すのかなって思ったら、１１２９もほらその、１１月２９日って読んだら、ちょうどゴロがいいかなって思ってよ…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「いや、…偶然だろうけどな。俺の誕生日、７月１５日なんだ。…０７１５が７月１５日を示すのかなって思ったら、１１２９もほらその、１１月２９日って読んだら、ちょうどゴロがいいかなって思ってよ…」
Russian (RU): "Ну... возможно это и совпадение, но мой день рождения 15 июля. ...Стоило мне подумать, что 0715 может относится к 15 июля, меня посетила мысль, что 1129 означает 29 ноября, и это как раз подходит..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Bem, ...provavelmente é uma coincidência, mas meu aniversário...é dia 15 de julho. ...Quando eu pensei que 0715 poderia se referir a 15 de julho, eu percebi que 1129 sendo 29 de novembro, talvez se encaixasse perfeitamente..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「呀，…是出於偶然吧。我的生日是，7 月 15 日。…一想到 0715 如果代表著 7 月 15 日的話，那這個 1129，也是念作 11 月 29 日，會比較對稱吧…」

Umineko Project (UP): Once we started imagining that the eight digits, which we had thought were meaningless, were actually two dates written together, it really started to look that way.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando começamos a imaginar que aqueles oito dígitos, que pensamos não ter significado algum, eram, na verdade, datas escritas juntas, realmente começou a parecer que aquele era o significado.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 本以为毫无意义的八位数，看起来越来越像是写在一起的两个日期了。

Umineko Project (UP): And from his still‐opened eyes, ...all my condolences to Auntie Eva, ......but I couldn't pick up any signs of life.
Steam (ST): And judging by his still-opened eyes, ...I'd hate to say it to Aunt Eva, ...but I couldn't pick up any signs of life.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And from his still opened eyes, ...I'd hate to say it to Eva oba-san, ......but I couldn't pick up any signs of life.
PC Japanese (JP): そして見開いたままの瞳からは、…絵羽伯母さんには悪いが、……生きている気配を感じることはできなかった。
Russian (RU): И судя по его открытым глазам... Мне бы не хотелось говорить этого тёте Еве, но мне не удалось выявить каких‐либо признаков жизни.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E de seus olhos ainda abertos, ...todas as minhas condolências à tia Eva, ......mas eu não pude ver qualquer sinal de vida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖說這麼說對繪羽姑母有點抱歉，…但從大哥睜著的眼睛裡，……感受不到一絲活人的光彩。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽说这么说对绘羽姑母有点抱歉，…但从大哥睁着的眼睛里，……感受不到一丝活人的光彩。

Umineko Project (UP): After moving to take his pulse, ...Doctor Nanjo shook his head, wordlessly reporting that George‐aniki was dead.
Steam (ST): After moving to take George's pulse, ...Doctor Nanjo shook his head, wordlessly reporting that George was dead.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After moving to take George's pulse, ...Doctor Nanjo shook his head, wordlessly reporting that George was dead.
PC Japanese (JP): 南條先生は脈を取るような仕草をした後、…首を横に振り、もはや死んでいることを無言で告げる。
Russian (RU): После проверки наличия пульса у Джорджа, Доктор Нанджо лишь покачал головой, молча констатировав, что Джордж был мёртв.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Após se movimentar para pegar seu pulso, ...O doutor Nanjo balançou a cabeça, informando sem quaisquer palavras que o George‐aniki estava morto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 南條大夫替他把了把脈後，…搖了搖頭，無言地宣告了，大哥已死。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 南条大夫替他把了把脉后，…摇了摇头，无言地宣告了，大哥已死。

Umineko Project (UP): Brushing him aside, Auntie Eva once again crouched beside George‐aniki, and started crying at the top of her lungs...
Steam (ST): Brushing him aside, Aunt Eva once again crouched beside George-aniki... and started crying at the top of her lungs...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Brushing him aside, Eva oba-san once again crouched beside George-aniki, and started crying at the top of her lungs...
PC Japanese (JP): それを押しのけ、絵羽伯母さんは再び譲治の兄貴にしがみ付くと、あらん限りの声を張り上げて泣き叫んだ…。
Russian (RU): Отпихнув его в сторону, тётя Ева снова присела рядом с Джорджем‐аники, и начала рыдать во всю силу своих лёгких...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Empurrando ele, a tia Eva mais uma vez se agachou ao lado do George‐aniki, e começou a chorar o mais alto que foi capaz...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 推開南條大夫，繪羽姑母再次撲到讓治大哥的身上，扯開嗓子，嚎啕大哭了起來…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 推开南条大夫，绘羽姑母再次扑到让治大哥的身上，扯开嗓子，嚎啕大哭了起来…。

Umineko Project (UP): With this, ...Aniki's death, one thing had become certain.
Steam (ST): With Aniki's death, ...one thing is certain.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): With this, ...Aniki's death, one thing is certain.
PC Japanese (JP): この、…兄貴の死で、ひとつ確実にわかったことがある。
Russian (RU): Таким образом... Смерть Аники лишь подтвердила одну вещь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com isso, ...com a morte do aniki, uma coisa se tornou certa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這次的，…大哥之死，令我們確切地明白了一件事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这次的，…大哥之死，令我们确切地明白了一件事。

Umineko Project (UP): The murders would not be ending at the eighth twilight.
Steam (ST): The murders hadn't ended on the eighth twilight.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The murders hadn't ended at the eighth twilight.
PC Japanese (JP): 殺人は、第八の晩まででは終わらない。
Russian (RU): Убийства не прекратились на восьмых сумерках.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os assassinatos não iriam ter fim no oitavo crepúsculo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 殺人並不會在第八晚結束。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 杀人并不会在第八晚结束。

Umineko Project (UP): The epitaph was going to be carried out in its complete form, including the ninth twilight, "and none will be left alive"...
Steam (ST): The epitaph was being carried out in its complete form, including the ninth twilight, "And none shall be left alive"...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The epitaph was being carried out in its complete form, including the ninth twilight, 'and no one will be left alive'...
PC Japanese (JP): 第九の晩の、“そして誰も生き残れない”までを含めて、全て完全な形で実行されるのだ…。
Russian (RU): Эпитафия воспроизводилась в полном виде, в том числе и девятые сумерки — "и кто в живых остался — будет мёртв"...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O epitáfio está sendo conduzido até o seu final, incluindo o nono crepúsculo, "e ninguém deve sobreviver"...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 連第九晚的“無人生還”也包括在內，一切都會以完全的形式，被付諸實行…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 连第九晚的“无人生还”也包括在内，一切都会以完全的形式，被付诸实行…。

Umineko Project (UP): I'm really starting to lose the plot.
Steam (ST): I was really starting to lose track of things.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I was really starting to lose track of things.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺はもう何が何やらわからなくなる。
Russian (RU): Я уже начинал переставать понимать, что происходит.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu já não estou mais entendendo isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我已經啥都搞不懂了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我已经啥都搞不懂了。

Umineko Project (UP): ...For some reason, Auntie Eva's half‐insane cries and appearance actually made me cool down...
Steam (ST): ...For some reason, Aunt Eva's half-crazed cries actually made me cool down...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...For some reason, Eva oba-san's half-insane cries actually made me cool down...
PC Japanese (JP): …絵羽伯母さんの半狂乱な泣き声が、なぜかかえって、俺を冷めさせた…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …絵羽伯母さんの泣き喚く声と様子が、なぜかかえって、俺を冷めさせた…。
Russian (RU): ...Но по какой‐то причине отчаянные рыдания тёти Евы только успокоили меня...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Por algum motivo, o choro quase que insano da tia Eva e sua aparência na verdade me acalmaram...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …不知為何，繪羽姑母嚎啕大哭的聲音和樣子，反倒令我心寒…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …不知为何，绘羽姑母嚎啕大哭的声音和样子，反倒令我心寒…。

Umineko Project (UP): ...Crestfallen and exhausted, I flopped onto the sofa, and plunked my feet on top of the table.
Steam (ST): ...Crestfallen and exhausted, I flopped onto the sofa and plunked my feet on top of the table.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Crestfallen and exhausted, I flopped onto the sofa and plunked my feet on top of the table.
PC Japanese (JP): …がっくりと脱力した俺は、どさりとソファーに腰を落とし、どっかりと足をテーブルの上に投げ出した。
Russian (RU): ...Удрученный и разбитый, я плюхнулся на диван, закинув ноги на стол.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Cabisbaixo e exausto, eu me atirei no sofá, jogando meus pés para cima da mesa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …猛然虛脫了的我，撲通一聲，坐進了沙發裡，重重地把腳甩到了桌子上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …猛然虚脱了的我，扑通一声，坐进了沙发里，重重地把脚甩到了桌子上。

Umineko Project (UP): Maybe all of these murders have paralyzed my heart. ......Instead of fright, the stronger emotion I'm feeling is one of complete confusion.
Steam (ST): Maybe all these murders numbed my heart. Instead of just being frightened, I felt completely confused.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maybe all of these murders had paralyzed my heart. Instead of just being frightened, I felt completely confused.
PC Japanese (JP): 何度も繰り返される殺人に、俺の心は麻痺してしまったんだろうか。……恐ろしいというよりも、訳がわからないという気持ちの方が強い。
Russian (RU): Возможно, из‐за всех этих убийств моё сердце окончательно зачерствело. Вместо того, чтобы бояться, я чувствовал себя окончательно запутавшимся.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Talvez todos esse assassinatos tenham paralisado meu coração. ......Ao invés do pavor, a emoção mais forte que eu estava sentido era a de completa confusão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我的心是因為一次又一次反覆發生的殺人事件而變得麻木了嗎？……比起害怕，莫名其妙的心情要來得更強烈。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我的心是因为一次又一次反复发生的杀人事件而变得麻木了吗？……比起害怕，莫名其妙的心情要来得更强烈。

Umineko Project (UP): Dad and Kyrie‐san have died, and starting with the servants, people have been killed off one by one. ...And at one hell of a pace, too.
Steam (ST): Dad and Kyrie-san are dead, and people have been killed off one by one, starting with the servants. ...And there's been a hell of a lot of them by now.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Dad and Kyrie-san died, and starting with the servants, people have been killed off one by one....And there's been a hell of a lot of them by now.
PC Japanese (JP): 親父も霧江さんも死に、使用人の人たちを皮切りに、次々、次々に殺された。…そりゃあもうすげぇ勢いでだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 親父も霧江さんも死に、使用人の人たちを皮切りに、次々に殺された。…そりゃあもうすげぇ勢いでだ。
Russian (RU): Папа и Кирие‐сан погибли, и, начиная с прислуги, людей стали убивать одного за другим. ...И их уже набралось чертовски много.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Meu pai e a Kyrie‐san haviam morrido, começando com os serviçais, as pessoas foram mortas uma após a outra. ...E tudo isso seguiu de forma impetuosa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 老爸也死了，霧江姐也死了，以傭人們的死為開端，人們接連被殺。…這勢頭就已經夠猛的了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 老爸也死了，雾江姐也死了，以佣人们的死为开端，人们接连被杀。…这势头就已经够猛的了。

Umineko Project (UP): I don't know what time the first murders started, ...but I'd say we're probably being killed at a rate of about one person an hour.
Steam (ST): I don't know when the first murder happened, ...but they might have been killed at a rate of about one person per hour by now.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I don't know what time the first murders started, ...but they probably weren't killed with the speed of a single person.
PC Japanese (JP): 最初の殺人が何時の時点で始まったか知らねぇが、…それこそ、時速１人くらいのスピードで殺されてるんじゃねぇだろうか。
Russian (RU): Я точно не знаю, в какое именно время начались эти убийства, но предположительно нас убивали со скоростью одного человека в час.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não sei em que momento os primeiros assassinatos começaram, ...mas eu diria que provavelmente foi uma taxa de uma pessoa morta por hora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然不知道第一起殺人是從幾點開始的，…但我們應該是在以時速一人左右的速度被殺吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然不知道第一起杀人是从几点开始的，…但我们应该是在以时速一人左右的速度被杀吧。

Umineko Project (UP): We believe that the boat will come for us around nine tomorrow. ......There's still a full twelve hours until then.
Steam (ST): We believe that the boat will come for us around 9:00 tomorrow. ...There's still a full 12 hours until then.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We believe that the boat will come for us around 9:00 tomorrow.......There's still a full 12 hours until then.
PC Japanese (JP): 明日の９時くらいに、船が迎えに来てくれると俺たちは信じている。……それまで、まだ１２時間以上もたっぷりあるんだぞ。
Russian (RU): Мы рассчитали, что катер приплывёт за нами около девяти завтрашнего утра. ......До этого времени ещё оставалось целых 12 часов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nós acreditamos que o barco chegaria para nos buscar amanhã por volta das nove horas. ......Ainda há doze horas até lá.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我們相信，到明天九點左右，就會有船來接我們離開了。……在此之前，還有足足十二個多小時。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我们相信，到明天九点左右，就会有船来接我们离开了。……在此之前，还有足足十二个多小时。

Umineko Project (UP): ...How many more sacrifices to the witch would there have to be for us to survive...?
Steam (ST): ...How many more sacrifices to the witch will there have to be for us to survive...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=ST]
PC Japanese (JP): …あと、魔女の生贄が何人いてくれりゃ、俺たちは生き残れるってんだ…。
Russian (RU): ...Сколько ещё жертв должно потребоваться ведьме, чтобы мы выжили?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Por quantos sacrifícios da bruxa ainda teremos que sobreviver...?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …還要獻給魔女多少活祭，我們才能得以生還呢…？
Chinese Simplified (CN): …还要献给魔女多少活祭，我们才能得以生还呢…？

Umineko Project (UP): With the four of us, if one goes each hour, ...we won't last any longer than four hours. It's not clear anymore if we'll even last until midnight tonight...
Steam (ST): With the four of us, if one goes each hour, ...we won't last any longer than four hours. We don't even know if we'll last until midnight tonight...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): With the four of us, if one goes each hour, ...we won't last any longer than four hours. We don't even know if we'll last until midnight tonight...
PC Japanese (JP): 俺たち４人じゃ、１時間に１人で、…４時間しかもたない。今夜の２４時だって、もはや迎えられるかわからないのだ…。
Russian (RU): С нами четверыми, если она будет забирать по одному в час... Мы продержимся не больше четырёх часов. Мы даже не знаем, протянем ли мы до полуночи...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com quatro de nós, se for um por hora, ...nós não iremos durar mais do que quatro horas. Já não está mais claro se nós vamos sequer durar até a meia‐noite...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 以我們這四人，一小時一人，…只能撐四小時。連能不能迎來今晚的二十四點都不知道…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 以我们这四人，一小时一人，…只能撑四小时。连能不能迎来今晚的二十四点都不知道…。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Yesterday, after lunch, we came into this parlor.
Steam (ST): ...Yesterday, after lunch, we came into this parlor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……昨日、この客間には、昼飯の後に入った。
Russian (RU): ......Вчера, после обеда, мы сидели в этой гостиной.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ontem, após o almoço, nós viemos para essa sala de visitas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……昨天我吃完午飯後，來到了這客廳。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……昨天我吃完午饭后，来到了这客厅。

Umineko Project (UP): At about the time that the discussion had turned to the black tea that Auntie Rosa said she bought, we kids had started talking about going to take a walk.
Steam (ST): Just as they started talking about serving some tea Aunt Rosa had bought, we kids decided to take a walk.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): About the time that the discussion had turned to the black tea that Rosa oba-san had bought or something, we kids had started talking about going to take a walk.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座叔母さんが買ってきたとかいう紅茶を淹れようという話になった辺りで、ちょうど俺たちは散歩に行こうって話になったんだ。
Russian (RU): В то время, когда началась беседа о чёрном чае, купленном тётей Розой, мы, дети, заговорили о том, чтобы пойти на прогулку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando a discussão passou a ser o chá preto que a tia Rosa disse que havia trazido, nós crianças começamos a falar sobre sairmos para caminhar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後，當大人們說起，要泡樓座姑母買來的紅茶時，我們幾個決定了出去散步。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后，当大人们说起，要泡楼座姑母买来的红茶时，我们几个决定了出去散步。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Maria was fooling around.
Steam (ST): ...Maria was jumping around, wasn't she?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Maria had been fooling around.
PC Japanese (JP): ……真里亞がはしゃいでたな。
Russian (RU): ......Мария весело дурачилась.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......A Maria estava se divertindo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……真里亞很高興，活蹦亂跳的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……真里亚很高兴，活蹦乱跳的。

Umineko Project (UP): ...Didn't Shannon‐chan bring us some cookies?
Steam (ST): ...Didn't Shannon-chan bring us some cookies?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Hadn't Shannon-chan brought us some cookies?
PC Japanese (JP): …紗音ちゃんが、クッキーを持ってきてくれたっけ。
Russian (RU): ...Разве Шаннон‐чан не принесла нам немного печенья?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...A Shannon‐chan não tinha nos trazido alguns cookies?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …我記得，紗音也拿來了小甜餅吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …我记得，纱音也拿来了小甜饼吧。

Umineko Project (UP): She said that Kumasawa‐san had baked them, or something.
Steam (ST): She said Kumasawa-san had baked them, or something.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She had said that Kumasawa-san had baked them, or something.
PC Japanese (JP): 熊沢さんが焼いたとか言ってたな。
Russian (RU): Она говорила, что Кумасава‐сан сама их испекла.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela tinha dito que a Kumasawa‐san havia assado, ou algo assim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 還說了，那是熊澤婆婆烤的呢。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 还说了，那是熊泽婆婆烤的呢。

Umineko Project (UP): ......I'd probably have laughed my ass off if there had actually been a cooked mackerel one mixed in with them.
Steam (ST): ...It would've been hilarious if she'd baked some mackerel into them, wouldn't it?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......I'd probably have laughed if she had actually baked some mackerel in them.
PC Japanese (JP): ……サバの焼いたのでも本当に入ってりゃあ笑えたのになぁ。
Russian (RU): ......Я бы, наверное, расхохотался, запеки она в них скумбрию на самом деле.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eu provavelmente teria me matado de rir se na verdade eles tivessem sido assados juntos com cavalinha misturada na massa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……如果真的放著烤鯖魚的話，那就好笑了啊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……如果真的放着烤鲭鱼的话，那就好笑了啊。

Umineko Project (UP): ............That's right, I'll never hear Kumasawa baa‐chan's mackerel jokes again, will I...
Steam (ST): ......That's right, I'll never hear Kumasawa baa-chan's mackerel jokes again, will I...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ............That's right, I'll never hear Kumasawa baa-chan's mackerel jokes again, will I...
PC Japanese (JP): …………そっか、熊沢の婆ちゃんのサバネタも、もう聞けねぇんだなぁ。
Russian (RU): ............Это верно, мне больше никогда не доведётся послушать шутки про скумбрию от бабули Кумасавы...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ............Isso mesmo, eu nunca mais vou ouvir as piadas de cavalinha da Kumasawa baa‐chan de novo, vou...?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …………是啊，熊澤婆婆的鯖魚笑話，已經再也沒機會聽了啊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …………是啊，熊泽婆婆的鲭鱼笑话，已经再也没机会听了啊。

Umineko Project (UP): ...Oh yeah, if I only remember stuff about Kumasawa baa‐chan, that wouldn't be fair to everyone else...
Steam (ST): ...Oh, right, if I only remember stuff about Kumasawa baa-chan, that wouldn't be fair to everyone else...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Oh yeah, if I only remember stuff about Kumasawa baa-chan, that wouldn't be fair to everyone else...
PC Japanese (JP): …おっと、熊沢の婆ちゃんのことだけしか思い出さなかったら、他の人たちに申し訳ねぇや…。
Russian (RU): ...Ах да, я ведь вспомнил лишь про бабулю Кумасаву, что несправедливо по отношению к остальным...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Ah sim, se eu só lembrar coisas da Kumasawa baa‐chan, não vai ser justo com os outros...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …等等，要是光回憶熊澤婆婆的事，對其他人就不太好意思了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …等等，要是光回忆熊泽婆婆的事，对其他人就不太好意思了…。

Umineko Project (UP): .........Why did Dad and Kyrie‐san...even go outside?
Steam (ST): ......Why did Dad and Kyrie-san...even go outside?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ............Why did Dad and Kyrie-san, ...even go outside?
PC Japanese (JP): …………親父も霧江さんも、…どうして表になんか出たんだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ………親父も霧江さんも、…どうして表になんか出たんだ。
Russian (RU): ............Зачем Папе и Кирие‐сан... вообще понадобилось выходить наружу?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Por que meu pai e a Kyrie‐san...foram lá pra fora?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …………老爸也是、霧江姐也是，…幹嘛非要到外面去啊？
Chinese Simplified (CN): …………老爸也是、雾江姐也是，…干嘛非要到外面去啊？

Umineko Project (UP): It's not like we'd die from being without food for a day.

Steam (ST): Did some kind of impact cause the trigger to be pulled...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=ST]
PC Japanese (JP): それで何かの拍子に引き金が引かれてしまったということなのか…。
Russian (RU): И по чистой случайности оказался задет спусковой крючок?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E algum movimento acabou fazendo com que o gatilho fosse puxado...?

Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后，就不知怎的，误打误撞地扣下了扳机吗…？

Umineko Project (UP): I didn't know the details, about whether the bullet had grazed her, or whether she had been burned by the discharge, but whatever the case, Jessica was covering both of her eyes, screaming in pain, and rolling around on the floor.
Steam (ST): I didn't know if the bullet had grazed her or if she'd been burned by the discharge, but either way, Jessica was covering both of her eyes, screaming "It hurts, it hurts" and rolling around on the floor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I didn't know the details about whether the bullet had grazed her, or whether she had been burned by the discharge, but anyways, Jessica was covering both of her eyes, screaming 'it hurts, it hurts' and rolling around on the floor.
PC Japanese (JP): 弾丸がかすったのか、発砲炎で火傷したのか、詳しいことはわからないが、とにかく朱志香は両目を覆って、痛い痛いと叫びながら床を転げ回っている。
Russian (RU): Я не знаю всех подробностей относительного того, задела ли её пуля или же её обожгло огнём выстрела, но в любом случае, Джессика держалась за свои глаза, крича "больно, как больно", катаясь по полу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu não sei os detalhes, se a bala passou de raspão por ela, ou se ela foi queimada pela descarga, mas em qualquer caso, a Jessica estava cobrindo ambos os olhos, gritando de dor, rolando pelo chão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然不知道具體是槍彈擦傷了，還是開槍時的火舌造成了灼傷，但總之朱志香抱著雙眼，喊著“好痛好痛”，在地板上滾來滾去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然不知道具体是枪弹擦伤了，还是开枪时的火舌造成了灼伤，但总之朱志香抱着双眼，喊着“好痛好痛”，在地板上滚来滚去。

Umineko Project (UP): "......It's alright, calm down...! It is not a serious wound, so get ahold of yourself...!"
Steam (ST): "...Don't worry, calm down...! It is not a serious wound, so get ahold of yourself...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......It's alright, calm down...! It is not a serious wound, so get a hold of yourself...!"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……没事的，冷静点…！不是大伤，请镇定…！」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "My eyes hurt, it hurts... ...I can't see, ...I can't see......!!"
Steam (ST): "My eyes hurt, it hurts... ...I can't see, ...I can't see...!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "My eyes hurt, it hurts..., ...I can't see, ...I can't see......!!"

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Meus olhos estão doendo, estão doendo... ...Eu não consigo enxergar, ...eu não consigo enxergar......!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「眼睛好痛，好痛…，…看不見，…看不見……！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「眼睛好痛，好痛…，…看不见，…看不见……！！」

Umineko Project (UP): Doctor Nanjo lent Jessica his shoulder, saying that he would tend to her in the servant room.
Steam (ST): Doctor Nanjo let Jessica borrow his shoulder, saying that he would tend to her in the servant room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Doctor Nanjo let Jessica borrow his shoulder, saying that he would tend to her in the servant room.
PC Japanese (JP): 南條先生は朱志香に肩を貸し、使用人室で手当てをすると言った。
Russian (RU): Доктор Нанджо подставил Джессике плечо, и сказал, что им нужно отправиться в комнату прислуги.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O doutor Nanjo apoiou a Jessica em seu ombro, dizendo que iria cuidar dela na sala dos serviçais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 南條大夫用肩膀擔起了朱志香，說要送她去傭人室，替她治療。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 南条大夫用肩膀担起了朱志香，说要送她去佣人室，替她治疗。

Umineko Project (UP): ......The servant room in this mansion apparently had a bed and a first aid kit, and was able to function as an infirmary.
Steam (ST): ...The servant room in this mansion had a bed and a first aid kit and was able to function as an infirmary.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......The servant room in this mansion had a bed and a first aid kit, and was able to function as an infirmary.
PC Japanese (JP): ……この屋敷の使用人室にはベッドや救急箱があり、保健室的な機能があるとのことだった。
Russian (RU): ......В комнате прислуги в этом особняке находились аптечка и кровать, поэтому её можно было использовать в качестве лазарета.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Aparentemente a sala dos serviçais da mansão tem uma cama e um kit de primeiros socorros, e também pode funcionar como uma enfermaria.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……這棟大屋的傭人室裡有床、有急救箱，具有保健室的功能。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……这栋大屋的佣人室里有床、有急救箱，具有保健室的功能。

Steam (ST): "Damn iiiiiit!! You killed Mom and Dad!! I'll kill you, I'll kill you...!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Damn iiiiiit!! You killed Mom and Dad!! I'll kill you..., I'll kill you......!!"

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I, ......it wasn't me..., it wasn't me......!!"

Umineko Project (UP): "Jessica‐san, you are aggravating the wound, so please, stop struggling...! Come, let us go to the servant room..."
Steam (ST): "Jessica-san, you'll aggravate the wound, so don't move about...! Come, let us go to the servant room..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Jessica-san, you are aggravating the wound, so don't act so reckless...! Come, let us go to the servant room..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「朱志香さん、傷に障りますから、それ以上、騒がないで…！　さぁ、使用人室に行きましょう…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「朱志香さん、傷に障りますから、それ以上、騒がないで…！　さぁ、使用人室に行きましょう…」
Russian (RU): "Джессика‐сан, у тебя серьёзные повреждения, поэтому не будь так безрассудна!... Идём, идём в комнату прислуги..."

Umineko Project (UP): Jessica still continued to curse Auntie Eva as her parents' murderer.{n}It seemed that Auntie Eva couldn't conceal her shock at the fact that she had pulled the trigger, even if it had been an accident.
Steam (ST): Jessica continued to curse Aunt Eva as her parents' murderer. It seemed that Aunt Eva couldn't conceal her trembling at the fact that she had pulled the trigger, even if it had been an accident.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Jessica cursed Eva oba-san as her parents' murderer even more than she had before. It seemed that Eva oba-san couldn't conceal her trembling at the fact that she had pulled the trigger, even if it had been an accident.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香はなおも、絵羽伯母さんを両親の仇だと罵っている。絵羽伯母さんは、過失とはいえ、引き金を引いてしまった事実に、動揺を隠せない様子だった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 朱志香はなおも、絵羽伯母さんを両親の仇だと罵っている。{n}絵羽伯母さんは、過失とはいえ、引き金を引いてしまった事実に、動揺を隠せない様子だった。
Russian (RU): Джессика проклинала тётю Еву как убийцу её родителей ещё яростней, чем прежде.{n}Было видно, что тётя Ева не могла сдержать свою дрожь, вызванную тем, что она нажала на спусковой крючок, даже если это и вышло случайно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Jessica continuou a acusar a tia Eva de ser a assassina de seus pais.{n}Parece que a tia Eva não conseguia esconder seu choque pelo fato de ter puxado o gatilho, mesmo que tenha sido de forma acidental.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 朱志香還在把繪羽姑母罵成殺害雙親的仇人。{n}雖說是過失，但繪羽姑母看來也是因為扣下扳機的事實，掩藏不住心中的混亂了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 朱志香还在把绘羽姑母骂成杀害双亲的仇人。{n}虽说是过失，但绘羽姑母看来也是因为扣下扳机的事实，掩藏不住心中的混乱了。

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...It wasn't my fault..., this happened because that kid jumped at me............I didn't kill anyone...

Umineko Project (UP): "......No, forget that... Who killed George? That's right, who killed George?!! George, Geooooooooooorge!! It isn't my fault, it isn't my fault...!!"
Steam (ST): ...More importantly, ...who killed George? That's right, who killed George?!! George, Geooooooooooorge!! It isn't my fault, it isn't my fault...!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......More importantly, ...who killed George? That's right, who killed George?!! George, Geooooooooooorge!! It isn't my fault, it isn't my fault...!!"

Steam (ST): "W-Wait a sec, Aunt Eva...!! Don't go off on your own!!"

Umineko Project (UP): I didn't know whether it was because Auntie Eva couldn't stand her mistake, or whether it was because she had lost herself to anger at the person who had killed her only son, ...or whether it was both of those all mixed together.
Steam (ST): I didn't know if it was because Aunt Eva couldn't bear her mistake... or if she'd given up control of her body to anger at the person who had killed her only son... or if it was both of those all mixed together.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I didn't know whether it was because Eva oba-san couldn't stand her mistake, or whether it was because she had given up control of her body to anger at the person who had killed her only son, ...or whether it was both of those all mixed together.
PC Japanese (JP): 絵羽伯母さんは、自分の過失に耐えられなくなったのか、それとも一人息子を殺した犯人への怒りに身を任せたのか、…それらがぐちゃぐちゃに混ざったのかわからない。
Russian (RU): Я не знаю, случилось ли так потому, что тёте Еве было невыносимо осознание собственной ошибки, или потому, что она больше не могла контролировать своё тело из‐за гнева на человека, убившего её единственного сына... Или же всё это навалилось на неё разом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu não sabia se era porque a tia Eva não conseguia suportar seu erro, ou se era porque ela estava completamente perdida devido a sua raiva contra a pessoa que havia matado seu único filho, ...ou talvez pudesse ser uma mistura das duas coisas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 搞不懂繪羽姑母是承受不住自己所犯的過失，還是被對殺害獨子的犯人的憤怒所支配，…又或者，兩者一起，糊里糊塗地混在了一起。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 搞不懂绘羽姑母是承受不住自己所犯的过失，还是被对杀害独子的犯人的愤怒所支配，…又或者，两者一起，糊里糊涂地混在了一起。

Umineko Project (UP): ...In any case, she ran out into the corridor, yelling, fearful, and shouting.
Steam (ST): ...At any rate, she ran out into the corridor, yelling, fearful, and screaming.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Anyways, yelling, fearful, and shouting, she ran out into the corridor.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Em qualquer caso, ela correu para o corredor, gritando, temerária, e descontrolada.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): I was also worried about Jessica's condition, but anyways, right then, I couldn't leave Eva oba-san alone.

Russian (RU): Меня тоже беспокоило состояние Джессики, но в любом случае, в данный момент я не мог оставить тётю Еву одну.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu também estava preocupado com as condições da Jessica, mas mesmo assim, naquele momento, eu não podia deixar a tia Eva sozinha.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Why would she go off on her own in this mansion, of all places? Is she suicidal...?!
PC Japanese (JP): よりにもよって、この屋敷の中でひとりになるなんて、自殺行為もいいとこだ…！

Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...I chased after Eva oba-san, dashing into the depths of the mansion......

Original Witch Hunt (OG): After sitting Jessica on the servant room bed, Nanjo told her several times not to touch her eyes, and examined the affected area.
PC Japanese (JP): 南條は使用人室のベッドに朱志香を座らせると、目を擦ってはいけないと何度も言い聞かせ、患部の様子を診た。
Russian (RU): Усадив Джессику на кровати в комнате прислуги, Нанджо несколько раз наказал ей не трогать глаза и осмотрел пострадавшие участки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Após colocar a Jessica sentada na cama da sala dos serviçais, Nanjo disse a ela diversas vezes para não esfregar os olhos, e examinou a área atingida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 南條讓朱志香在傭人室的床上坐下，反覆提醒了好幾次“不可以揉眼睛”後，診察起了她的傷勢。

Umineko Project (UP): The barrel had probably been near her eyes.{n}There was a possibility that the flames from the discharge had damaged her corneas.
Steam (ST): The barrel had probably been near her eyes. There was a possibility that the flames from the discharge had injured her corneas.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The barrel had probably been near her eyes. There was a possibility that the flames from the discharge had injured her corneas.
PC Japanese (JP): 銃口に目が近かったのだろう。発砲の時の炎で、角膜を傷付けた可能性がある。

Umineko Project (UP): Nanjo applied emergency first aid, covering the affected area with gauze and wrapping it with a bandage. As a result, Jessica completely lost her field of vision...
Steam (ST): Nanjo applied emergency first aid, covering the affected area with gauze and wrapping it with a bandage. As a result, Jessica completely lost her field of vision...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Nanjo applied emergency first aid, covering the affected area with gauze and wrapping it with a bandage. As a result, Jessica completely lost her field of vision...

Speaker: Nanjo Terumasa

Steam (ST): "Is that okay...? The wound may hurt or itch, but you mustn't scratch at it or rub it. When tomorrow comes, let us go to an ophthalmologist as soon as possible."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "......That bitch, ...she really was trying to kill me... If the angle had been just a little bit off, I'd have been killed by now... I'll definitely turn her in to the police......!"
Steam (ST): "...That bitch, she really was trying to kill me... If the angle had been just a little bit off, I'd have been killed by now... I'll definitely turn her in to the police...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......That bitch, she really was trying to kill me... If the angle had been just a little bit off, I'd have been killed by now... I'll definitely turn her in to the police......!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……あいつめ、…本当は私を殺すつもりだったんだ…。ほんのちょっと角度が悪かったら、今頃殺されてた…。絶対にあいつを警察へ突き出してやる……！」
Russian (RU): "......Эта сука, она действительно пыталась убить меня... Ещё бы совсем чуть‐чуть изменить угол и я была бы уже мертва... Я обязательно сдам её в полицию!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Aquela puta, ...ela estava mesmo tentando me matar... Se o ângulo fosse um pouco mais pro lado, eu já estaria morta agora... Eu juro que vou entregar ela à polícia......!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……那傢伙，…其實是想殺了我的…。只要角度稍微偏一點，現在我就已經被殺了…。絕對要把那傢伙扭送給警察……！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……那家伙，…其实是想杀了我的…。只要角度稍微偏一点，现在我就已经被杀了…。绝对要把那家伙扭送给警察……！」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "Accident my ass...! She killed Mom and Dad. There's no way any 19th person or witch exists on this island...!! She's behind everything. She was the only one on the first floor of the guesthouse!"

PC Japanese (JP): 「事故なもんか…！　あいつが父さんと母さんを殺したんだ。この島には１９人目も魔女もいるわけがない…！！　あいつが全ての犯人なんだ。ゲストハウスの１階にはあいつだけがいた！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「事故なもんか…！　あいつが父さんと母さんを殺したんだ。この島には１９人目も魔女もいるわけがない…！！　あいつが全ての犯人なんだ。ゲストハウスの１階にはあいつだけがいた！」
Russian (RU): "Вы называете это несчастным случаем?! Она убила папу и маму. Никакого 19‐го человека или ведьмы на этом острове нет!.. Она стоит за всем. Она единственная оставалась на первом этаже домика для гостей!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Acidente ô caramba...! Ela matou meus pais. Não tem como uma 19ª pessoa ou uma bruxa existirem nessa ilha...!! Ela está por trás de tudo. Ela era a única no primeiro andar da casa de hóspedes!"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「才不是意外呢…！那家伙，杀了我爸我妈。这个岛上，既不可能有第十九人，也不可能有魔女…！！那家伙是所有事件的真凶。待在宾馆一楼的，就她一个！」

Speaker: Nanjo Terumasa
Umineko Project (UP): "So for now, Jessica‐san, you should concentrate on resting your body and making things easy on your eyes. ...If you wrinkle your forehead too much, it will do no good for your eyes, of course, and nothing for your looks either."
Steam (ST): "So for now, Jessica-san, you should devote yourself to resting your body and keeping your eyes safe. ...Of course, if you wrinkle your forehead too much, it will do nothing good for your eyes, not to mention your beauty."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So for now, Jessica-san, you should devote yourself to resting your body and keeping your eyes safe. ...Of course, if you wrinkle your forehead too much, it will do nothing good for the beauty of your eyes."
PC Japanese (JP): だから朱志香さんは、今は体を休め、目を楽にすることに専念するのです。…あまり眉間にしわを寄せては、目にはもちろん、美容にもよくありませんぞ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「だから朱志香さんは、今は体を休め、目を楽にすることに専念するのです。…あまり眉間にしわを寄せては、目にはもちろん、美容にもよくありませんぞ」
Russian (RU): "Так что сейчас, Джессика‐сан, тебе в первую очередь следует думать об отдыхе для своего тела и позаботиться о своих глазах. ...Если же ты продолжишь так морщить лоб, ничего хорошего для красоты твоих глаз это не сулит."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Então, por ora, Jessica‐san, você precisa se concentrar em descansar seu corpo e melhorar seus olhos. ...Não é bom para seus olhos que fique enrugando muito sua testa e, é claro, também não será bom para a sua aparência."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「所以，朱志香，現在先休養身體，專心於令眼睛好受些。…過度皺眉，甭提眼睛了，就連對美容都有壞處吶。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「所以，朱志香，现在先休养身体，专心于令眼睛好受些。…过度皱眉，甭提眼睛了，就连对美容都有坏处呐。」

Umineko Project (UP): Indeed, when Jessica had grown agitated in her verbal abuse of Eva, she had naturally started glaring, and the pressure on her eyes hurt her.
Steam (ST): When Jessica's abuse of Eva had reached a crescendo, she actually had started glaring instinctively, and the pressure on her eyes had hurt her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In actuality, when Jessica grew agitated in her abuse of Eva, she had naturally started glaring, and the pressure on her eyes hurt her.
PC Japanese (JP): 実際、朱志香が絵羽のことを罵り感情を高ぶらせれば、自然と睨みつけるような仕草になり、目を圧迫するため、傷を痛ませた。
Russian (RU): И действительно, когда Джессика начала высказывать свои подозрения по поводу Евы, она принялась строить сердитое лицо, из‐за чего глазное давление стало причинять ей боль.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De fato, quando Jessica ficou agitada durante seus abusos verbais contra Eva, ela naturalmente começou a encará‐la, com a pressão em seus olhos causando dor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 實際上，朱志香一罵起繪羽，高漲起情緒，就會自然而然地做出瞪人的動作，壓迫眼球，弄疼傷處。

Umineko Project (UP): Jessica herself soon realized that the more she talked, the more the wound would hurt, and regardless of whether she had overcome her suspicions of Eva, she regained her composure for the time being...

PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香もその内、喋れば喋るほど傷が痛むことに気付き、絵羽への疑いを解いたかどうかは別にして、とりあえず落ち着きを取り戻すのだった…。
Russian (RU): Джессика сама успела понять, что чем больше она говорит, тем больше ранит свои глаза, и решив на время оставить свои подозрения по поводу Евы, она постаралась немного успокоиться...

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela havia ouvido que Kanon tinha sido morto na capela.{n}...Jessica ainda não havia visto seu rosto depois que ele morreu.
